result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lynell Ray III

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court with Lynell Ray III.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Discovery and offer received.  Defense request a plea and sentencing.  Defendant is in compliance with JusticePoint.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, received and filed.

Defendant Lynell Ray III in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Lynell Ray III.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense request another scheduling conference
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report (Missed Office Contact)

Defendant Lynell Ray in court in person with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris who appears by video.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 15.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.14.2022
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Lynell Ray in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 15. Case set for Hearing as to Counsel. Defendant has been appointed counsel. Case adjourned, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Lynell Ray not in court, defendant in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE hearing. Court date given by Br. 15 clerk.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lynell Ray in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Lynell Ray in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lynell Ray appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Motion to dismiss COUNT 1 by defense for lack of probable cause argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lynell Ray III
Current: 4158 N 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 06-03-2022)
Prior: 6490 North 106th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53224
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Lynell Ray not in court.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/17/2022@2:00p
